titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that law enforcement service dogs and their handlers perform a vital role in providing for our Nation's security and should be recognized for their service.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Mr. Cohen moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1614.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/15/2010--Passed House without amendment. Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that law enforcement service dogs and their handlers perform extraordinary services and make an important contribution to national security and public safety.
